abstractText: The identification of channel units provides the context for the survey of fish habitat attributes and channel topography. Channel units are classified using a two-tiered system (Figure 7): Tier I and Tier II. Tier I units are Fast Water Turbulent, Fast Water Non-Turbulent, and Slow Water/Pool. Tier II classifications break Tier I units d own to a finer scale. Generally, channel units are at least as long as the wetted channel width. Figure 8 provides context in regards to the spacing and resolution of channel units in a typical survey.
title: Channel Unit Classification v2.0
